title: Amanda Holden, David Walliams, Caroline Flack dazzle at Global Gift Gala
text:
The stars came out in force (Picture: Rex, Getty)

The stars flocked to this year’s Global Gift Gala tonight with Amanda Holden leading the glamorous a-list squad, with the likes of Eva Longoria, Strictly’s AJ Pritchard and Saffron Barker, and David Walliams also gracing the red carpet.

Britain’s Got Talent judge Amanda was pretty hard to miss on the red carpet as she donned a red gown with a plunging neckline and cut-outs around the side of her thighs.

After strutting along the red carpet, the 48-year-old met up with David Walliams and Caroline Flack once inside.

Elsewhere on the red carpet, Desperate Housewives actress Eva Longoria shone to the gods in a sequin power suit and hugged her pal, Melanie Griffith, as they posed for photos.

The Hollywood stars, who are honorary chairs of the charity, had spent time with children at a special needs school, Haringey’s Vale, in north London on Wednesday.

Walliams, 48, did the honours of hosting the prestigious event which was held at the Kimpton Fitzroy London Hotel.

Proceeds from the Global Gift Gala go towards the Global Gift Foundation, a non-profit organisation that aims to create a positive impact on the lives of women, children and families around the world.

Melanie visited children at a special needs school as part of the Global Gift Gala (Picture: Rex Features)

Paloma Faith was scheduled to perform at the swanky event and to receive the empowerment award for being her amazing inspirational self.

Before heading into the gala, Strictly Come Dancing stars AJ Pritchard and Saffron Barker revealed how they are getting along after being forced to pull out of rehearsals due to the YouTuber’s back injury.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk on the red carpet, Saffron admitted: ‘It definitely has affected it, we haven’t been able to do as many hours as we would have liked to, from what we have done previously.

‘It’s only getting harder, the competition. So we have struggled. But we’re getting through it. Our last day has been successful.’

AJ added: ‘We just can’t get it done as many times. We’ve just got to be efficient, getting it done, and then going for dinner!’
